results.title: Round the twist: skeleton on the dunny
results.creator_credit: Antonia Barnard, Esben Storm and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When the Twists move from the city to live in an old lighthouse, they discover that the outside dunny is haunted. One stormy night they decide to have a showdown with a very flushed ghost.

results.title: Round the Twist: Series 1
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, Paul Jennings, Esben Storm and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
An international award winning Australian comedy series based on the stories of celebrated children’s author, Paul Jennings. Each of the stories told in the thirteen self-contained episodes of Series 1 follows the adventures of the Twist kids – Pete, Linda, Bronson – who have moved to the coastal town of Port Niranda with their Dad. Living in a haunted lighthouse, they encounter bizarre magical devices, neurotic ghosts, rampaging entrepreneurs and sneering school bullies.
A uniquely quirky kid’s TV series loved by generations of the young-at-heart.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Edgar, Paul Jennings, Esben Storm and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist: Santa Claws
results.creator_credit: Antonia Barnard, Paul Jennings, Mark Lewis and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Pete’s dream comes true when he meets Santa Claws Number 115,302 who grants each member of the Twist family two wishes, something they all end up wishing had never happened.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonia Barnard, Paul Jennings, Mark Lewis and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.creator_credit: Antonia Barnard, Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Pete becomes irresistible to women with the help of some magic lipstick. Dad wants the lipstick too but Gribble Junior steals it, much to his regret.

results.title: Round the twist: lighthouse blues
results.creator_credit: Antonia Barnard, Paul Jennings, Esben Storm and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Gribble and his partner evict the Twists from the lighthouse in order to build an amusement park. But with the help of some friendly ghosts, the Twists win the battle to save their home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonia Barnard, Paul Jennings, Esben Storm and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist: know all
results.creator_credit: Antonia Barnard, Paul Jennings, Esben Storm and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twists find a trunk full of old circus costumes and dress the scarecrow in a clown’s outfit. But the scarecrow comes to life and chases Linda. Fortunately Dad, dressed as a fortune teller, sees and knows all.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonia Barnard, Paul Jennings, Esben Storm and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist: birdsdo
results.creator_credit: Antonia Barnard, Paul Jennings, Esben Storm and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Nell is committed to hospital for believing in dragons; so Linda, Pete and Bronson set off to prove her sanity. While rogue seagulls imprison Linda and Pete in a shack buried in bird droppings, Bronson finds the dragon’s egg and Nell is released.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonia Barnard, Paul Jennings, Esben Storm and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist Series 4 - Volume 7 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Helen Watts, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley and Arnie Custo
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Hair Brain” Linda gets an advantage in her campaign for election to the student council after a weird experience with hair products. In “The Princess and the Pete” Pete finds the course of true love doesn’t run smoothly. “Boy Bird” has Bronson discovering a magical singer; while in “The Shadow Player” Linda gets some bad news from her own shadow. “Radio Da Da” sends Linda and Peter time travelling, and Bronson performs good but smelly deeds as “Skunkman”. In “Isle of Dreams” the Twists meet the Princess of Atlantis and have a difficult decision to make. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.

results.title: Round the twist Series 4 - Volume 6 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Helen Watts, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley and Arnie Custo
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Welcome Back”, the ghosts see their chance to stage a comeback in the play being performed to celebrate Port Niranda’s bicentenary. In “Monster Under the Bed” the Lintmonster under Bronson’s bed demonstrates the dire consequences of neglecting the cleaning. In “Linda Godiva”, Linda becomes invisible. Peter turns into a werewolf in “Dog By Night”. In “TV Or Not TV” all the Twist kids get (literally) sucked into their TV. “Face The Fear” has Bronson colliding with hidden loot, ghosts and escaped convicts in the local cemetery. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.
